result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John Raymond Moore

records.addlTxt:
2:14 PM Defendant John Raymond Moore appeared by video.  Attorney Amanda K. Riek appeared by video for John Raymond Moore.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
2022TR000809, 2022TR000810, 2022TR000826 tracking with 22CF77:
Atty Riek is waiting on some records that were requested; asks for a Prelim to be set.

BY THE COURT:  Set Preliminary Hearing in person unless a waiver, then it may be by zoom
bond continued
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on November 8, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

10:22 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant John Raymond Moore appeared by phone.  Attorney Amanda K. Riek appeared by video for John Raymond Moore. 
Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading. Court advises defendant of the maximum penalties. Atty Riek waives time limits for preliminary hearing.  Defendant agrees.
BY THE COURT:  Court finds time limits have been waived.  Set for status.
Status hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status hearing on September 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
for Leave to File Additional Motions

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: *No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license   *Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no possession or consumption of any alcohol   *No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription

3:17 PM Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant John Raymond Moore appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Diana Van Rybroek appears as a special appearance on behalf of the defendant for bond. 
2022TR000809, 2022TR000810, 2022TR000826 tracking with 22CF77:
Atty Van Rybroek states that the defendant does not qualify for PD appointment.  Court confirms address and phone. Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands. 
Court finds probable cause for the charges for Riverside purposes. 

Atty Burdon requests a $500 cash bond with conditions.
Atty Van Rybroek makes bail arguments and questions probable cause on Count 3.  Atty Burdon responds.  Court will continue the probable cause but the State will have to look into Count 3 probable cause.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Cash bond with conditions: 
*No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license 
*Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no possession or consumption of any alcohol 
*No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription
Initial appearance scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on July 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.
